org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin22.servlet

Class SimpleSpringServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.vaadin.flow.server.VaadinServlet
          • org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin22.servlet.SimpleSpringServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class SimpleSpringServlet
extends VaadinServlet
    A variant of SpringServlet that doesn't require Spring Boot, supports traditional XML configuration for Spring and servlets via web.xml, and adds support for tracking and limiting sessions.

    This class needs a way to find the ApplicationContext; this is done by findApplicationContext(). The implementation in this class obtains the ApplicationContext from the a Springleton bean which must be declared within it.

    In addition, your ApplicationContext may need to have a bean with an @EnableVaadin annotation, in order to bring in other beans required by Vaadin Spring, such as VaadinScopesConfig.

    You can accomplish both of these tasks by including a class like this in your application context: 

    
 import com.vaadin.flow.spring.annotation.EnableVaadin;
 import org.dellroad.stuff.spring.Springleton;

 @EnableVaadin
 public class MySpringleton extends Springleton {

     public static MySpringleton getInstance() {
         return (MySpringleton)Springleton.getInstance();
     }
 }

    You may also need to include an AppShellConfigurator bean with the appropriate application-wide annotations.

    The ApplicationContext can be created however you want; traditionally, this is done via ContextLoaderListener.

    Note: Unlike SpringServlet, this servlet does not pull servlet parameters like FooBar from corresponding vaadin.foo_bar variables found in the ApplicationContext's Environment.

    The servlet associated with the current thread can be found via forCurrentSession().

    Additional supported servlet parameters:

    Parameter Name Required? Description
    sessionTracking No Boolean value that configures whether to track Vaadin sessions; default false. If set to true, then getSessions() can be used to access all active sessions. Session tracking should not be used unless sessions are normally kept in memory; e.g., don't use session tracking when sessions are being serialized and persisted, or when this servlet may be serialized. See also VaadinSessionDataProvider.
    maxSessions No Configures a limit on the number of simultaneous Vaadin sessions that may exist at one time. Going over this limit will result in a ServiceException being thrown. A zero or negative number means there is no limit (this is the default).
    See Also:
    VaadinSessionDataProvider, vaadin-spring issue #560, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • SESSION_TRACKING_PARAMETER

        public static final String SESSION_TRACKING_PARAMETER
        Servlet initialization parameter ("sessionTracking") that enables tracking of all Vaadin session.

        This parameter is optional, and defaults to false.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_SESSIONS_PARAMETER

        public static final String MAX_SESSIONS_PARAMETER
        Servlet initialization parameter ("maxSessions") that configures the maximum number of simultaneous Vaadin sessions. Requires SESSION_TRACKING_PARAMETER to be set to true. This parameter is optional, and defaults to zero, which means no limit.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getSessionCount

        public int getSessionCount()
        Get the current count of active VaadinSessions associated with this instance.
        Returns:
        current number of sessions

      • getSessions

        public List<VaadinSession> getSessions()
        Get all live VaadinSessions associated with this servlet.
        Returns:
        live tracked sessions, or an empty collection if session tracking is not enabled
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this servlet instance has been serialized
        See Also:
        VaadinSessionDataProvider

      • findApplicationContext

        protected ApplicationContext findApplicationContext()
        Find the root ApplicationContext to be used by this servlet.

        The implementation in SimpleSpringServlet delegates to ApplicationObjectSupport.getApplicationContext().

        Returns:
        the ApplicationContext for this servlet to use
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no application context can be found or has been established yet

      • forSession

        public static SimpleSpringServlet forSession(VaadinSession session)
        Get the SimpleSpringServlet that is associated with the given VaadinSession.
        Parameters:
        session - Vaadin session
        Returns:
        the assocated SimpleSpringServlet
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the VaadinServlet associated with session is not a SimpleSpringServlet
        IllegalArgumentException - if session is null

      • forCurrentSession

        public static SimpleSpringServlet forCurrentSession()
        Get the SimpleSpringServlet that is associated with the current VaadinSession.
        Returns:
        the SimpleSpringServlet associated with the current thread
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no VaadinSession associated with the current thread
        IllegalStateException - if the current VaadinServlet is not a SimpleSpringServlet
